channel.title: MidwestWeekends - Travel in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Iowa
channel.description: Up-to-date information on travel in the Upper Midwest

item.title: Destination: Stockholm
item.description: Once the promised land, this Lake Pepin village now is a favorite day trip.

item.title: America's freshwater Riviera
item.description: On the gorgeous beaches of Wisconsin, Michigan, Indiana and Illinois, everyone can find a spot in the sun.

item.title: Grand sand
item.description: Along Lake Michigan, the Sleeping Bear Dunes are a giant playground for families.

item.title: All eyes on Wabasha
item.description: Eagles are drawn to this Mississippi River town, along with flocks of binocular-toting visitors.

item.title: A slice of cheese country
item.description: On Wisconsin's Badger State Trail, bicyclists bite off as much as they can chew.

item.title: Cycling in coulee country
item.description: The famous Elroy-Sparta is just one of the trails in a picturesque pocket of Wisconsin.

item.title: Hiking in Duluth
item.description: The city sections of the Superior Hiking Trail are easy to reach and amazingly scenic.

item.title: Summer in the Brainerd Lakes
item.description: Away from the crowds, Minnesota's busiest vacation area can be tranquil.

item.title: Dreaming of Ely
item.description: The wilderness around this north-woods town exerts a magnetic pull on city folk.

item.title: Discovering Two Harbors
item.description: This Lake Superior port town on Minnesota's North Shore is all about trains, boats and automobiles.

item.title: Winter in Ely
item.description: At the edge of the northern Minnesota wilderness, fun starts when the snow falls.

item.title: Where to eat in Duluth
item.description: Once famous for dives, this Lake Superior tourist magnet now boasts brewpubs and locavore cafes.
